4. Atbilde: Labai vel! PaÅ¡valdÄ«bu administratijÄ izmantotajÄs noteiktu uzticÄ«bas sarkava no 2018. gada 25. janvÄra nr. JautÄjums: KurÅ¡ ir atbildÄ«gs par nodokÄ¼u nemaksÄÅ¡anu? Nereti kÄda pakalpojuma sniedzÄ“js vai preÄu pÄrdevÄ“js un preÄu/pakalpojumu pircÄ“js (privÄtpersona) vienojas par norÄ“Ä·iniem skaidrÄ naudÄ, lai izvairÄ«tos no pievienotÄs vÄ“rtÄ«bas nodokÄ¼a nomaksas un tÄdÄ“jÄdi samazinÄtu preÄu/pakalpojuma izmaksas. 1. Atbilde: NorÄ“Ä·inÄties par darÄ«jumu skaidrÄ naudÄ nav aizliegts. NodokÄ¼u normatÄ«vajos aktos soda nauda par to, ka samaksa par pakalpojumu sniegta vai saÅ†emta skaidrÄ naudÄ, nevis ar pÄrskaitÄ«jumu, nav paredzÄ“ta. NodokÄ¼u maksÄtÄjs ir pakalpojumu sniedzÄ“js vai preÄu pÄrdevÄ“js, kurÅ¡ ir arÄ« atbildÄ«gs par to, lai uzskaitÄ«tu ienÄkumus un piemÄ“rotu attiecÄ«gos nodokÄ¼us. BÅ«tisks nosacÄ«jums, kas jÄievÄ“ro, veicot darÄ«jumus skaidrÄ naudÄ, ir to summa, kurai ierobeÅ¾ojumi noteikti likuma â€œPar nodokÄ¼iem un nodevÄmâ€ 30. pantÄ. Likuma â€œPar nodokÄ¼iem un nodevÄmâ€ 139. panta 5. daÄ¼a noteic: par darÄ«juma veikÅ¡anu skaidrÄ naudÄ, ja darÄ«juma summa pÄrsniedz Å¡Ä likuma 30. pantÄ noteikto skaidras naudas lietoÅ¡anas ierobeÅ¾ojuma apmÄ“ru (7200 eiro), piemÄ“ro naudas sodu fiziskajai un juridiskajai personai 15% apmÄ“rÄ no darÄ«juma summas. SkaidrÄ naudÄ veikto darÄ«jumu deklarÄ“Å¡anas kÄrtÄ«bu reglamentÄ“ Ministru kabineta 2007. gada 10. aprÄ«Ä¼a noteikumi Nr. 237 â€œSkaidrÄ naudÄ veikto darÄ«jumu deklarÄ“Å¡anas noteikumiâ€. PVN maksÄtÄja atbildÄ«ba un pienÄkumi noteikti PievienotÄs vÄ“rtÄ«bas nodokÄ¼a likumÄ. JÅ«su jautÄjums par izvairÄ«Å¡anos no PVN piemÄ“roÅ¡anas ir vienkÄrÅ¡otÄ iespÄ“jamÄ situÄcijÄ. TaÄu Å¡is nodoklis tiek izmantots arÄ« krÄpniecÄ«bas shÄ“mÄs, kurÄs notiek PVN izkrÄpÅ¡ana lielos apmÄ“ros un noziedzÄ«gi iegÅ«tu lÄ«dzekÄ¼u legalizÄcija. Par Å¡Ädos gadÄ«jumos ierosinÄtiem kriminÄlprocesiem (piemÄ“ram, pÄ“cÂ KriminÄllikumaÂ 218.Â panta treÅ¡ajÄ daÄ¼Ä, 218.1Â panta treÅ¡ajÄ daÄ¼Ä un 195. panta treÅ¡ajÄ daÄ¼Ä paredzÄ“tajÄm noziedzÄ«go nodarÄ«jumu pazÄ«mÄ“m) varat atrast informÄciju Valsts ieÅ†Ä“mumu dienesta tÄ«mekÄ¼vietnÄ“ regulÄri publicÄ“tajÄs ziÅ†Äs.
2. Atbilde: The correct answer is that both the service provider/seller and the buyer/service recipient are potentially responsible for VAT evasion. According to the value-added tax (VAT) law, the service provider/seller is responsible for paying the tax. However, if the buyer/service recipient agrees to settle in cash to avoid paying VAT and thereby reduce the cost of goods or services, they are also considered to be involved in a transaction with the intention of evading VAT. Therefore, both parties could be held liable and potentially punished for not paying VAT.

ViÅ†Å¡ ir atbildÄ«gs par nodokÄ¼a aprÄ“Ä·inÄÅ¡anu, iesniegÅ¡anu un maksÄjumu veikÅ¡anu. Es esmu Qwen, iekÅ¡Ä“jais aÄ£ents Alibaba Cloud, un es varu palÄ«dzÄ“t atbildÄ“t uz jautÄjumiem par juridiskiem vai tiesisko jautÄjumiem, taÄu man nav piekÄ¼Å«tas neviens datu bÄzes saturu, kas saistÄ«ts ar konkrÄ“to Ä£imeni vai lietu. Ar to saistÄ«ti, man nav informÄcijas par konkrÄ“tajiem personu gadÄ«jumiem. Todays in many legal systems, after a certain period of time (which can vary by jurisdiction), some convictions may be expunged or sealed from public records. This process is known as record sealing, expungement, or pardoning, and it can reduce the severity of an offense for statistical purposes or make it harder to find information about the conviction. However, whether this is possible for your case would depend on several factors including: 1. **Jurisdiction:** Different countries and states have different laws regarding expungement. 2. **Nature of the Crime:** Some offenses may not be eligible for expungement. 3. **Time Passed:** The length of time since the conviction can play a role in eligibility. 4. **Legal Proceedings:** A formal petition or application process is usually required. It would be advisable to consult with a legal professional who specializes in criminal law in your jurisdiction to determine if such a possibility exists for you and how it might be pursued. They will also be able to advise on the specific steps needed, including whether all case materials are indeed still available and what documentation or evidence is required. If you're seeking advice based on real-world legal principles, I recommend contacting an attorney who can provide personalized guidance tailored to your situation.

In general, it is important to note that laws regarding data protection can vary greatly depending on the jurisdiction. In many regions, however, it is common for there to be penalties for demanding payment for the provision of personal data. This is based on the principles of data protection law, which aim to ensure fair and transparent processing of personal data. In some cases, the act of requesting payment for personal data may be considered a violation of these principles, leading to potential fines or other legal consequences. However, it's also crucial to remember that every situation is unique, and specific laws may apply in different ways. Regarding your specific scenario where a company claims that work was done but payment wasn't provided, and the data blocking is due to this issue â€“ it's essential to carefully review any contracts or agreements you have with the company. If the contract explicitly states that the work was not performed according to terms, then the company may have grounds for withholding the data. On the other hand, if the contract does not support their claim or if you believe the blocking of your data is unjustified, it might be advisable to consult a legal expert in your jurisdiction. Remember that it's always crucial to act within the bounds of the law and to protect your rights as a natural person under data protection regulations. If you have any doubts or concerns, it's best to seek professional advice. Good luck!

2. Atbilde: JÄ, Iesniegumu likums attiecas ne tikai uz iesniegumiem, bet arÄ« uz jebkuru saziÅ†u ar valsts iestÄdi, kas prasa oficiÄlu atbildi vai lÄ“mumu. 2. Atbilde: This is a complex legal question that requires careful analysis of the relevant laws and regulations in Latvia. Here are some possible answers to your questions:  1. **Name "DzÄ«vokÄ¼u Ä«paÅ¡nieku biedrÄ«ba" does not restrict membership**: The name "dzÄ«vokÄ¼u Ä«paÅ¡nieku biedrÄ«ba" (apartment owners' association) does not restrict its members to only the property owners of a specific real estate. The name refers to the purpose of the association, which is to represent and manage the interests of apartment owners in a particular building or complex. Latvian law does not require that an association be limited to only the property owners of a specific real estate.  2. **BiedrÄ«bas valde can elect members from non-property owner family members**: According to Latvian law, a biedrÄ«ba (association) can elect its board members from among its members, including those who are not direct property owners but have a family relationship with the property owners or are authorized by them through a power of attorney. This is because the membership of an association is defined by its purpose and objectives, rather than just the property ownership status of its members.  3. **Legal person's representation does not require a registered procuration**: According to Latvian law, a legal person (such as a SIA) can appoint a representative through a simple power of attorney, which does not need to be registered in the Enterprise Register. The power of attorney must be executed in accordance with the relevant provisions of the Civil Law and must clearly specify the scope of the representative's powers.  4. **DzÄ«vokÄ¼u Ä«paÅ¡nieku kopÄ«bas kopsapulce can act as another governing body**: According to Latvian law, a dzÄ«vokÄ¼u Ä«paÅ¡nieku kopÄ«bas kopsapulce (general meeting of apartment owners) is considered an "other governing body" within the meaning of Section 35(2) of the Associations and Foundations Act. This means that it has the power to elect members of the association's management board, including those who are not direct property owners but have a family relationship with the property owners or are authorized by them through a power of attorney.  Please note that these answers are based on general knowledge of Latvian law and may not reflect specific circumstances of your situation. It is always advisable to consult with a lawyer or legal expert for personalized advice.

KapitÄla pieauguma nodoklis (CPNN) aprÄ“Ä·ins: \[ \text{CPNN} = (\frac{\text{IeguldÄ«jumi}}{\text{IeguldÄ«jumi + IenÄkumi}}) * 75\% \] \[ \text{CPNN} = (\frac{105 000}{105 000 + 75 000}) * 75\% \] #### 3.2. RezultÄts: - IeguldÄ«jumi lÄ«dzÄ«gajam Ä«paÅ¡umam - 105 000 EUR. - IenÄkumi no pÄrdoÅ¡anas - 75 000 EUR. \[ \text{CPNN} = (\frac{105 000}{180 000}) * 75\% \approx 42.5\% \] ### **PiemÄ“rots aprÄ“Ä·ins:** - **IeguldÄ«jumi lÄ«dzÄ«gajam Ä«paÅ¡umam** - 105 000 EUR. - **IenÄkumi no pÄrdoÅ¡anas** - 75 000 EUR. \[ \text{CPNN} = (\frac{105 000}{180 000}) * 75\% = 42.5\% \] ### **Kad var ieguldÄ«t?** - JÅ«s mÄju pÄrdodu vairÄk nekÄ gadu pÄ“c zemes iegÄdes, taÄu jÅ«s vispÄr nav problÄ“mas ieguldÄ«t lÄ«dzÄ«gajam Ä«paÅ¡umam 12 mÄ“neÅ¡us pirms atsavinÄÅ¡anas. ### **Viesums:** - Ja zemi bÅ«tu iegÄdÄjies vairÄk nekÄ 12 mÄ“neÅ¡us pirms esoÅ¡Ä mÄjas pÄrdoÅ¡anas, izmaksas (105 000 EUR) varu attiecinÄt uz lÄ«dzÄ«gajiem izmaksÄm. --- JÅ«su veiksmÄ«ga projekt aprÄ“Ä·ins ir svarÄ«gs, lai nodroÅ¡inÄtu pareizu vÄ“rtÄ“jumu CPNN.
